name: kazad
text: Don't be a bitch, Teodor

name: djwhiterabbit
text: c'mon, the boy's about to putt.  i ain't want some knucklehead on my cellular when i'm going for birdie.

name: overmedicated
text:
Please tell me I wasn't the only one who on first glance thought Teodor said "I'm a little busty."

PLEASE.

name: mortshire
text: You've just been visited, by the Freudian Faireee~.

name: johnnyc
text: Goooooood... tiiiiiits!

name: crankheart
text: this reminded me of that bit in 'hot fuzz'. you know the old guy? hehehe...

name: captain_arlo
text: The RUDEST!

name: riazm
text: if you enjoy people trying to get out of phone conversations due to sonic interference from bursting bubbles whilst on a golf course, you might also enjoy this strip

name: songbirdspectre
text: best observation of the month.

name: saucy_jack
text: That's a true thing to say, Riazm.

name: canusdivinus
text: Sweet, sweet revenge?

name: tetrisattack
text: A comment left by tetrisattack was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by NeoNaoNeo, whoper, d3lvn, earendil, Boyd, Audhumla)

name: gmm
text: Everyone who lamed this is foolish. Finding Nemo is goddamn brilliant but Toy Story is BETTER

name: tekende
text: IMO, Finding Nemo is not brilliant at all, but rather boring and irritating.

name: zapatos
text: His entire family is eaten, and then his child is deformed.  That is what you get for being a coward.

name: boredom_man
text: Do... do you people have children?

name: zapatos
text: i haven't been hit up for a child support cheque yet, so "no"

name: cdl146
text: I love how Ray can't be rushed. He even stops to take a long sip from his martini before finishing his sentence.

name: evolume
text: This reminded me of Pee Wee's phone conversation with Dottie when he was in Texas on his Big Adventure.

name: jonnay
text: The otter's world has been turned upside down in the las panel.

name: m-e-charm
text:
[ pause ]

"I'm a little busy."

makes this a 5/5.

name: wulvaine
text: Yes, it does. And I approve of Manuel Calaveras. I finally managed to get Grim Fandango to install on my Vista box last week, and I'm now playing it for the first time.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Double chubbies. Brilliant game.

name: drago25
text:
Hell with Finding Nemo;
you can unite a nation with Ice Age, that shit got to me like 3 times in a single viewing (which I know gives me no sack whatsoever but oh well)

name: charchar
text:
I was watching "Holes" with my stepmom, and we both started sniffing at the part when Zero's mom steps off the bus.

I think we maybe bonded a little.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
I first read that as "we maybe boned a little."

Pretty awesome.

name: charchar
text: Your story is better.

name: tekende
text: Oh hot

name: jaredwilde
text: Huh, me too. Weird. . .

name: heccibiggs
text:
Oh man, Ice Age is something CRAZY. You're talking about the bit when the mammoth sees the cave painting and remembers his family, right?

Have you seen Ice Age 2? When that chick mammoth remembers her baby past and is all alone and tiny... DAMN.

name: drago25
text:
That was one of the bits that got to me, yeah. That and the mother drifting away in the river when she leaves her baby. Oh and the ending. Haha.

I did see it, I don't remember it getting to me like the first one though. Damn, I be heartless sometimes.

name: daidai
text: I watched Ice Age in-flight on the way to China like 3 times in a row. Needless to say, that ruined it for me.

name: daidai
text: meanwhile, Bono cackled wildly as he prepared to write his second comment as "notbono"

name: daidai
text: what in the hell. i posted this on another strip

name: sp1derbaby
text: Teodor doesn't care. Ray cares less.

name: heccibiggs
text:
This strip has saddened me

because it made me realise I left my Finding Nemo DVD at home when I moved to uni.

name: heccibiggs
text: BREAKING NEWS: No I didn't.

name: fineoakstructure
text: 7 months...You must have one messy fucking apartment, heccibiggs

name: jimbob
text: Congrats, Josh.

name: joeynarcotic
text: I never saw Finding Nemo. Or Titanic. Or Independence Day. It's almost like I'm afraid of water (and aliens).
